author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In the land of the Germans, stout and hearty,
The labour market stands firm, for naught doth it tarry.
But a whisper of struggle, it doth loudly carry,
Like a barrel of ale, skimmed yet never left empty.

Next, in the kingdom of electronic dreams,
Microsoft unbundles, due to regulatory schemes.
'Tis like serving ye olde ale in separate streams,
Addressing concerns, in thine EU themes.

Lo, the oil in Chine doth lower stride,
Factory activity slowing, its strength resides.
Yet like an ale-house after eventide,
Still propped up by U.S. stocks, where hunger hides.

feedItems.title: Germany's Jobless Rate Holds Steady
feedItems.description: The German adjusted unemployment rate stood at 5.7% in August, reflecting continued resilience in the labor market, despite signals of a stuttering economy.

feedItems.title: Microsoft to Unbundle Teams Software in Europe
feedItems.description: The software giant says it aims to address concerns raised in an EU antitrust investigation.

feedItems.title: Oil Edges Lower on Weak Chinese Factory Data
feedItems.description: Brent inched down in Europe after data showed Chinese factory activity contracted for a fifth consecutive month in August, but the far larger than expected drawdown in U.S. crude stocks was putting a floor under oil’s declines.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In UBS's haughty hall, a wisp of glee,
Credit Suisse upheaval causes no dismay.
In banks holds sway, inflow free, towards sea,
Third quarter thrives, as dogs make their own way. 

Mighty Idalia, pelts the coast with scorn,
Through Carol's land she whirls, a tempest born.
In wake, snails drawn from their shell, forlorn,
The rabbit's burrow floods, and power's torn.

In India's market, a tale spun of gold,
Adani rebuts claims by critics bold.
A goat, they say, has bought its own wool sold;
Alas, each story twisted, truth enfolds.

feedItems.title: UBS's 2Q Shows Credit Suisse Upheaval Hasn't Hurt Business
feedItems.description: UBS’s second-quarter results are positive overall, with Credit Suisse’s domestic bank kept, similar targets to pre-acquisition and net inflows that have already turned positive by $8 billion in the third quarter so far, Deutsche Bank said.

feedItems.title: Idalia Churns Through South Carolina as Tropical Storm
feedItems.description: After making landfall on Florida’s Gulf Coast as a major hurricane, the storm moved quickly across Georgia and South Carolina, causing power outages and flooding.

feedItems.title: Adani Rejects Allegations by Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project
feedItems.description: Indian conglomerate Adani Group has rejected news reports that quoted documents obtained by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project that said the billionaire family secretly invested millions of dollars into India’s stock market to buy its own shares.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Amidst the slumber of Belgian shores, a warning doth resound,
Its foundations delicate as the ice, yet resilient like a hound.
But the bonds of the government stand strong, in Citi's praise they're found,
Guarded from the storm-tossed sea, 'gainst downgrades they're sound.

Misfortune dark descends on Pernod Ricard, the teller of liquid charm,
Tales of profits not met, and sales that cause alarm.
Yet steadfast doth their pledge remain midst the trading storm,
With golden promise for redemption, a shared bounty might disarm.

Speaks Impala, the bearer of Platinum, of coin earned but scant,
The bounty of their soil reduced, the harbingers recant.
Predicts a rise in cost, by a tenth or less in amount,
An echo in the mead hall, a drizzle paints their chant.

feedItems.title: Belgian Government Bonds Seen Shielded From Risks of Rating Downgrade
feedItems.description: Belgium’s fragile fundamentals could trigger a rating change but valuations of Belgian government bonds suggest they are shielded from a potential impact, Citi said.

feedItems.title: Pernod Ricard Results Disappoint, Shares Fall
feedItems.description: Pernod Ricard reported below-forecast sales and profit for fiscal 2023, but backed its medium-term financial targets and said it planned a €800 million share buyback. The stock opened almost 5% lower.

feedItems.title: Implats Profits Meet Lower End of Guidance
feedItems.description: Impala Platinum reported sharply lower earnings for fiscal 2023 as production fell, and forecast a 6%-10% rise in costs this year.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Upon data's whim, EUR/USD doth sway,
Banks with bated breath, to data bow,
Its volatile pulse, a minstrel's lay,
In market's ear, whispers low.

UBS and Credit Suisse, a union form,
Record profit reaped, to tune of twenty-nine,
An epic saga, in gold ink adorn,
In ledger books, their destinies entwine.

From Nippon's coast, the clarion call,
In face of looming China tensions rise,
An ample chest, with billions tall,
For long-neglected shield, the wise prize.

feedItems.title: Data Cause Volatility in EUR/USD
feedItems.description: EUR/USD has been highly volatile this week as central banks’ next steps remain dependent on the latest economic data, which are being closely scrutinized by markets, Commerzbank Research said.

feedItems.title: UBS Posts Record $29 Billion Profit on Credit Suisse Deal
feedItems.description: UBS booked a record $29 billion net profit last quarter after it integrated Credit Suisse into its books.

feedItems.title: Japan Looks to Boost Defense Budget by 13% and Add New Missiles
feedItems.description: China tensions loom over $53 billion plan, which raises funds for long-neglected maintenance.
